results.title: The Aftermath
results.creator_credit: WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Channel Four
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Art of the western world”.
World War II cast a shadow over the development of artists in the post-war years. Virtually every visual arts mode from classical antiquity onwards has had advocates within living memory. Nevertheless, there are substantially novel and radically opposed artistic enterprises which emerged from this time and found form in movements such as Abstract Expressionism, Pop Art and Minimalism.

results.title: The African trade
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Time watch”.
Between the sixteenth and nineteenth century, 12,000 million Africans were sold as slave labour. The sheer number of people made it the biggest example of forced migration. Accompanying a tour of African Americans tracing their painful past, this documentary postulates that the Trans-Atlantic slave trade was only made possible by the existence of a prolific slave trade already in Africa. This resulted in the formation of mutually beneficial partnerships between Europeans and Africans. Europe and America would benefit in the long term from the arrangement, but West Africa would be left with little, only a guilt which is often not acknowledged. Narrated by Josette Simon.

results.title: The African scene: youth builds a nation in Tanzania
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Visual Education Center, Toronto and H Lemieux
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of “nation-building” by showing girls of a government-operated secondary school in Tanzania helping their country to develop a better standard of living. Also shows use of co-operative farming as a means of increasing agricultural production and improving rural life.

results.title: The African Queen (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Horizon (US), Horizon (GB), Sam Spiegel, John Huston and James Agee
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart is the gin-soaked river tramp who reluctantly becomes a hero after rescuing a “skinny-psalm-singing-old-maid” (Katherine Hepburn) from the Germans during World War I. Their hazardous mission of escape becomes a pursuit as the odd pair survive malaria, insects, leeches and the persistent conflict of their personalities in order to destroy a German gunboat in the African Congo. Bogart won an Oscar for this role and the script was co-written by James Agee, based on C. S. Forester’s novel.

Bogart won an Oscar for this role and the script was co-written by James Agee, based on C. S. Forester’s novel.

results.title: The African Queen
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart is the gin soaked river tramp who reluctantly becomes a hero after rescuing a “skinny-psalm-singing old maid”, (Katherine Hepburn) from the Germans during World War 1. Their hazardous mission of escape becomes pursuit as the odd pair survive malaria, insects, leeches and the persistent conflict of their personalities in order to destroy a German gunboat. Bogart won the Oscar for best actor for his role and Huston’s script (co-written with James Agee) is remarkably efficient in disguising the narrative contrivances. Rated: G

results.title: The Affair-Quandary
results.brief_description: A woman is in a quandary about whether to confront her husband with her suspicions that he is having an affair. Her husband’s quandary is whether to tell his wife, leave his wife or break off the affair. This program will interest people in relationships, educators, counsellors, community health and women’s organisations and marriage counselling services.

results.title: The Adze and the chainsaw
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Tom Williamson and Pat McGuire
results.brief_description: Explores the question of whether Maori art should retain its traditional forms, or reflect changing experiences and new influences. Sequences include students making murals combining Maori legends with modern day experiences and the restoration of carvings using new techniques under the supervision of a traditional Maori artist. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels. Camera by Bayly Watson, edited by Ross Chambers, researched by Judith Wright.

results.title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
results.creator_credit: Selznick International, David O. Selznick, William H Wright and Norman Taurog
results.brief_description: In this story, we meet Tom, his aunt Polly, his cousin Sidney, girlfriend Becky, and his best friend and adviser Huckleberry Finn. Tom seems to be constantly drawn to trouble. His dangerous adventures, schoolboy pranks, and his painful cousin are highlights of this video. Based on the novel of Mark Twain.

results.title: The Adventures of the wishing chair
results.creator_credit: Cosgrove Hall Films, Abbey Home Entertainment and Jean Flynn
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Enchanted lands”.
A compilation of seven short animated stories from Enid Blyton’s Enchanted Lands series, “The Adventures of the wishing chair”. Let yourself be whisked away with Mollie, Peter and Jigs the Pixie on their amazing Wishing Chair to visit distant lands of magic, dreams and fantastical adventures. Meet some of the delightful, and not so delightful, characters along the way like Magician Greatheart, the Grabbit Gnomes and the playful Clown Gnomes. Beautifully animated with lots of colour, magic and movement. Suitable for primary school level.
